meanings.definition: A flat subspace of dimension one less than that of the ambient space.
meanings.sent1: In geometry class, we learned about hyperplanes as flat subspaces with one less dimension.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician studied hyperplanes extensively to understand their properties.
meanings.sent3: The hyperplanes at the math party were so flat, they could barely dance.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hyperplane of thoughts, intersecting at various points of understanding.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of hyperplanes floating in a sea of dimensions.

meanings.definition: A geometric object in a space of more than three dimensions that is the generalization of a plane in three dimensions.
meanings.sent1: Exploring the concept of hyperplanes in higher dimensions can be mind-boggling.
meanings.sent2: The scientist visualized hyperplanes as extensions of planes into multiple dimensions.
meanings.sent3: The hyperplanes in the alien's spaceship were unlike anything we had seen on Earth.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared through hyperplanes of existence, transcending the limits of reality.
meanings.sent5: The author described a world where hyperplanes connected distant realms in a seamless web.
